{"step_by_step_thinking": "The palatogingival groove is a developmental anomaly that is seen in certain teeth. It is a groove that extends from the palatal surface of the tooth towards the root. To determine which tooth the palatogingival groove is seen in, we need to consider the location of the groove and the teeth it is commonly associated with. The palatogingival groove is most commonly seen in the maxillary lateral incisor. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Maxillary lateral incisor.", "answer_choice": "B"}
